titles.title: A resolution recognizing the 193rd anniversary of the independence of Greece and celebrating democracy in Greece and the United States.
A resolution recognizing the 193rd anniversary of the independence of Greece and celebrating democracy in Greece and the United States.

action.text: Referred to the Committee on Foreign Relations.

calendar.text: Committee on Foreign Relations. Ordered to be reported without amendment favorably.

action.text: Committee on Foreign Relations. Reported by Senator Menendez without amendment and with a preamble. Without written report.

calendar.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 326.

vote.text: Resolution agreed to in Senate without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent.

term.name: Sovereignty, recognition, national governance and status

bill.summary:
(This measure has not been amended since it was introduced. The summary of that version is repeated here.)
Congratulates the people of Greece as they celebrate the 193rd anniversary of Greece's independence, and notes the important role that Greece has played in the wider European region and in the community of nations.
Supports the principles of democratic governance to which the people of Greece are committed.
